author: Ronald Le
title: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano
description: The marketplace remains fragmented, however, with liquidity still lacking on individual DEXes compared to their CEX counterparts.

assessments.note: A DEX aggregator is an important project to assure the liquidity of ADA related exchange pairs and will provide a lot of additional traffic on ADA related decentralized exchanges once they actually exist. At this moment however this is not the case, which is the reason for the 3 star rating. Funding and implementing of such a project will only make sense once decentralized exchanges exist on the Cardano network. If this was the case this assesment aspect would get 5 stars.

There are a quite a lot of DEX proposals circulating at the moment. Which is normal as DEXs  will be needed soon. So it is a good idea, but I was unable to find anything that would distinguish this proposal from others.

The problem statement is subjective. DEXs like Uniswap or Sushiswap have billions in liquidity among the various pooled assets, is this considered a lack of liquidity? I do not know, because this is subjective. 

Regardless, liquidity aggregating protocols like 1Inch or Paraswap are very useful in increasing liquidity between different DEXs and are an important part of DeFi.

In the plan(described in the attached file) there is no information about the development of a DEX aggregator, which makes it impossible to evaluate how the proposal will address the challenge and the suggested problem statement
Aggregating decentralized exchange can improve liquidity. With integration to the existing platform of Instamo, the integration is likely to result in the adoption of ADA for fund transfer.

Based on the information presented it is not clear how this proposal will bring new users to cardano blockchain. How the funds will be used isn't disclosed either. the pitch deck has a very large scope that is off chain and doesn't directly apply to Cardano. The pitch deck doesn't mention cardano or EUTXO once.

The idea is of this development is very good and is a good application of smart contracts. I would have liked to see more information about the tokenomics of this project. Will there be a token for the platform, or it will use ADA directly? Also, I understood based on the comment section that not only owners will be able to book houses, but any user, but it was not clear in the proposal itself. Some more information about the fees associated to the booking system and other details should also be included.
Please provide a detailed plan, not links to a google docs presentation.

While the company behind the proposal seems credible and competent, it is clear no effort was put in the plan for the concrete proposal and instead only a marketing presentation for a similar project by the company was provided. Since this idea has a lot of potential and it is an important, expensive project, I request the proposer to re-propose it in another funding round with a proper plan and diversified budget.

There are projects right here on Catalyst that offer very similar services and claim they can do it with less than half of the funding. After digging around in the slides, the cause of this amount is the projected cost of hiring new personnel (totalling 439,200 USD for this year alone). Which raises the question if this really needs that many people to operate? 
To make it more feasible of success, I'd suggest to merge with other projects.

There is no clarity in the purpose of the proposal. Without understanding the mission, it is not possible to understand the feasibility of the proposal and the relevance with the attached business plan.
The proposer has a strong well-established team and has a presence in Vietnam. It is likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully.

The plan presented is for a much larger project and it isn't clear how this money requested will be used within the larger ecosystem. If the proposal depends on the success of the remaining project scope then it may fail as a whole even if this one dex aggregator is successful. There is no detailed budget, scope, or timeline identified within this proposal. the team that would do the work isn't disclosed so there is high risk of failure.

Based on the alleged experience, roadmap and also in the budget breakdown that allocates $10k to the dApps developer, I believe that this project is feasible with the proposed budget. The team is also already engaged, there is a running website with good information and well designed. I don't see big challenges in implementing this, besides some legal risks involved that might be there but were not foreseen.

No details given. Please provide detail of what you are doing and how this fits in the competitive landscape. Provide a detailed budget to justify your $250,000 request, which is the entire fund budget.

While the information provided gives extensive information about the background and credibility of the company and about a money transfer service provided by it, there is no actual information given on how to implement the concrete proposal and no rationale for the budget. The proposal basically is non-existent and working on a topic that is at the moment not implementable atm because no decentralized exchanges exist on cardano at the moment.

Very elaborate roadmap in the slides. However, when it comes to sending vast amounts of money overseas, a risk assessment is advised. For example: The platform in mind operates by leveraging the licenses of other entities, but it is unclear how it would adapt if these licenses would expire.

The plan presented in the attached file is very well detailed, but it does not appear to have been developed for the Catalyst proposal. The proposal is asking for $ 250,000, but there is no detail on the budget allocation.

No metrics, KPIs, roadmap, milestones related to this challenge were described. The absence of this information compromises auditability.

I recommend creating a plan specifically for this proposal.

The proposal has a detailed document of Hawking Istamo but has limited information on how cross-chain liquidity and Cross-chain DEX will be implemented over Cardano. There is a need for specific technical analysis to identify how these technical challenges are planned to be overcome. The proposal is overall auditable ane the progress can be measured based on the number of users utilising the system.
the proposal is a small piece of a much larger scope, which makes it impossible to audit for completion. Especially when a detailed timeline, budget and scope are not disclosed.

The roadmap is clear with well defined dates. KPIs are good, but I believe there could be other KPIs related to other metric like number of users, visitors, people registered, number of bookings, etc. Budget breakdown is good. It would be good also to have some mapped risks associated with the project, as currently there are no risks mapped.

solution: DEX aggregators have emerged to pool that fragmented liquidity together into a single platform like Instamo to solve the problem.
